Posts.Content: Well, i never thought I would be searching out fellow cancer survivors after 11 years of NED..but here I am, with breast cancer in the other breast. They found it in a mammogram, it is small, so everyone assured me that a biopsy was not necessary, HA, had to make them biopsy it, and of course it came back cancer. You know when you just know. Anyhow, they did genetic blood testing, and shipped it off, so now we wait.... There it is..................here I am, my name is Norma, I live in a beautiful little town named: Solvang, in California. My new journey begins soon....................
Posts.Title: New here, from California

Posts.Title: New here, from California

Posts.Content: Yes, I agree, time to take off and go camping for a long long weekend. Loading up the fifth wheel and going to go camping for five days, then back to reality and surgery....and six weeks of radiation....burn baby burn....
Posts.Title: New here, from California

Posts.Content: Yes, I agree, time to take off and go camping for a long long weekend. Loading up the fifth wheel and going to go camping for five days, then back to reality and surgery....and six weeks of radiation....burn baby burn....
Posts.Title: New here, from California

Posts.Content: Well, had one surgery on 10/9 and another on 11/7 and now my radiation journey begins tomorrow.....ugh...........counting down 32 days....
Posts.Title: New here, from California

Posts.Content: The testing is for BRCA1 and BRCA2 (Hereditary breast cancer may be associated with a number of inherited conditions; however, mutations on two genes, called BRCA1 and BRCA2, have been the most studied by researchers in women with breast or ovarian cancer.) The results will help me decide if we do a lumpectomy or more invasive surgery. I can tell you that the biopsy process has come a long way, this one didnt really hurt. The one 11 years ago, I felt like i was harpooned......the pain was really bad. Just thankful it is small and that we caught it so early, i go every year for my mamo, and also my oncologist, so every six months someone is seeing me. I will keep you posted, thanks again for the welcome....Norma
Posts.Title: New here, from California

Posts.Content: well, had a lumpectomy on October 7th, went back today for post op appointment, and was told that my margins were not clear, so back I go on November 9th for more surgery...then I will do radiation....ugh. Margin on the chest wall side was not clear.
